person.note: Widely published on the literature and culture of the British Romantic period; specialist in the works of Charles Dibdin and founding director of Retrospect Opera, leading three projects to revive and record Dibdin’s music.

person.affiliation: Rare Book School, University of Virginia (Miranker Family Director of Collections, Exhibitions & Scholarly Initiatives)
person.note: Scholar of Charlotte Brontë’s manuscripts and publication history; co-author (with Ruth-Ellen St Onge) of “Building the Book from the Ancient World to the Present Day” (2022) and co-editor (with Donna A. C. Sy) of “Teaching Text Technologies and Critical Bibliography among the Disciplines: Objects of Study” (Routledge, 2025). Secretary of the Antiquarian Book School Foundation; member of the American Antiquarian Society and the Grolier Club.

person.affiliation: Colgate University, Professor of Music Emeritus
person.note: Honorary Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London. Author, editor, or translator of c. 40 books on Western esoteric traditions and speculative music; translator of the Hypernerotomachia Poliphili (1499), works of Hans Kayser, and the papers of the Gruppo di UR.

person.affiliation: Pennsylvania State University, E. E. Sparks Professor of English Emeritus
person.note: General editor of The Cambridge Edition of the Works of F. Scott Fitzgerald; most recent publication: The Cambridge Centennial Edition of The Great Gatsby (2025).

div.head: Bibliographical Society of the University of Virginia

list.head: Officers
list.item: President: David L. Vander Meulen (University of Virginia, English Department, 219 Bryan Hall, PO Box 400121, Charlottesville, VA 22904-4121)
Secretary-Treasurer: Anne G. Ribble (Bibliographical Society, University of Virginia Library, PO Box 400152, Charlottesville, VA 22904-4152)
Editor: David L. Vander Meulen (address as above)
Executive Secretary: Anne G. Ribble (address as above)

list.head: Council
list.item: Honorary Councilors: Ruthe R. Battestin; G. Thomas Tanselle

div.note: Membership is solicited per payment period in the following categories: Subscribing Members ($55); Student Members ($27.50); Contributing Members ($150 or more); Patrons ($250 or more); Benefactors ($500 or more). Contributing Members, Patrons, and Benefactors receive all publications of the Society and by their contributions assist in furthering the Society’s work. The names of individual and institutional members are listed below.

list.head: Patrons
list.item: Charles Kelly and Allison Sugiyama (Ann Arbor, MI)
Michael F. Suarez, S. J. (Charlottesville, VA)

div.head: Submissions and Correspondence
div.p: The editor invites articles and notes on analytical bibliography, textual criticism, manuscript study, and the history of printing and publishing, as well as related matters of method and evidence. Submissions following any widely used style-sheet are acceptable, although The Chicago Manual of Style is preferred. All copy, including quotations and notes, should be double-spaced. Manuscripts or electronic files should be sent to David Vander Meulen (dlv8g@virginia.edu), University of Virginia, English Department, 219 Bryan Hall, PO Box 400121, Charlottesville, VA 22904-4121.

All correspondence concerning business affairs, subscriptions, and memberships should be directed to the Executive Secretary, Anne G. Ribble, Bibliographical Society, University of Virginia Library, PO Box 400152, Charlottesville, VA 22904-4152; e-mail: bibsoc@virginia.edu.
